meanings.definition: To go beyond or exceed in stepping.
meanings.sent1: She was outstepping her classmates in the race.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outstep his previous record.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outstepping the others to reach the acorns first.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outstep her limitations was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The river outstepping its banks flooded the nearby fields.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in stepping.
meanings.sent1: He outstepped his opponent with a sudden burst of speed.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's graceful movements outstepped all others in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat outstepped the dog in a playful chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness always outsteps any negativity she encounters.
meanings.sent5: The outstepping gazelle leaped gracefully across the savanna.

meanings.definition: The act of stepping out or beyond.
meanings.sent1: His outstepping of the line caused a penalty in the game.
meanings.sent2: The outstepping of boundaries led to a new adventure.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's outstepping of the leash surprised its owner.
meanings.sent4: The outstepping into the unknown brought both fear and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The outstepping of tradition sparked a lively debate among the group.
